basics.name: Calvan Liang
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am a college student studying for a B.S. in Computer Science at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate by Spring 2021. I enjoy learning different aspects of computing technology. My focus is computer operation, management, and maintenance. I also have interest in web design, development, and management.

work.summary: Computer Lab Monitor for the Center for Language & Technology Computer Lab.
highlights: Provide lab users assistance in operating the computers and equipment
Troubleshoot and resolve various computer-related issues, of which could be hardware-related or software-related.
Assist students who cannot log onto their computer
Record the amount of people in the lab every hour

volunteer.summary: Member of a three man group that competes in the Cyberpatriot monthly competition.
highlights: Solve the presented scenario or problem

volunteer.summary: University of Hawaii Registered Indepedent Organization with focus on cybersecurity. A completely student-led extracurricular organization.
highlights: Learn various cybersecurity skills and application
Prepare for upcoming competitions such as Capture the Flag and CCDC

volunteer.summary: Cyber defense competition where an eight person team work to secure eight computers. We are the 'blue' side, who are working to defend against the attacking 'red' side.
highlights: Solve the presented scenario or problem

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students. Prerequisites include a rigorous high school curriculum and a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students. Prerequisites include a rigorous high school curriculum and a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: 28th Annual Physics Olympics Second Place
awards.awarder: American Association of Physics Teachers, Hawaii Section
awards.summary: A competition that tested students' knowledge of physics. My group and I were challenged with various physics problems and scenarios. We placed second.
